Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from three fragments with added plaster) of Attic black-figured pottery overlap Siana cup; interior: mostly glazed black with reserved band at rim and another below offset of lip; top of lip glazed; exterior: line between lip and handle zones, glazed below; over lip and handle zones black-figure decoration consisting of dancing figures (at left, youth with added red fillet and red on chest with left hand raised, dancing to right; facing him, woman dancing, to left with elbows out and hands in front of chest with fingers pointing down; added white flesh, red tunic with black lower border with incised wavy pattern between double incised lines; incised lines at neckline and arm holes; incised necklace; red fillet; some of hair tied back in club with red pom-pom at end); inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Harvard University Art Museums 1925.30.133 in Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups I and Komast Cups. Amsterdam 1983, pl. 5d, no. K87 and Göttingden H549a in Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups III. Amsterdam 2000, pl. 189.
